import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory

import os

    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")
source.786d77f2:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(15,3))
ax = fig.add_subplot(1, 3, 1)
sns.distplot(df.math_score,ax=ax, color = 'b')
plt.title('Math Score')
ax = fig.add_subplot(1, 3, 2)
sns.distplot(df.reading_score,ax=ax, color = 'b')
plt.title('Reading Score')
ax = fig.add_subplot(1, 3, 3)
sns.distplot(df.writing_score,ax=ax, color = 'b')
plt.title('Writing Score')
plt.show()
source.195b4d60:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(15,6))
ax = fig.add_subplot(1, 3, 1)
sns.barplot(x = 'gender', y = 'math_score', data = df)
ax.set_title('Math Score')
ax = fig.add_subplot(1, 3, 2)
sns.barplot(x = 'gender', y = 'reading_score', data = df)
ax.set_title('Reading Score')
ax = fig.add_subplot(1, 3, 3)
sns.barplot(x = 'gender', y = 'writing_score', data = df)
ax.set_title('Writing Score')
plt.suptitle('Gender vs Score')
plt.show()
source.8e116d51:
sns.countplot('race_ethnicity', data = df)
plt.title('Number of students from each Race/Ethnicity', fontsize=12)
plt.show()
source.c97c2199:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(12,6))
ax = fig.add_subplot(1, 3, 1)
sns.barplot(x = 'race_ethnicity', y = 'math_score', data = df)
ax.set_title('Math Score')
ax = fig.add_subplot(1, 3, 2)
sns.barplot(x = 'race_ethnicity', y = 'reading_score', data = df)
ax.set_title('Reading Score')
ax = fig.add_subplot(1, 3, 3)
sns.barplot(x = 'race_ethnicity', y = 'writing_score', data = df)
ax.set_title('Writing Score')
fig.tight_layout(rect=[0, 0.03, 1, 0.95])
plt.suptitle('Gender vs Score')
plt.show()

Male students are better at maths than female students.
Female students are better at both reading and writing than male students.

source.74787567:
# Student performance in Exam
In this notebook we are analysing student marks in three different subjects and the effect of different factors on their performance
source.e661f1b4: students who took preperation course perform better than other students
source.1e95043e: students who eat standard lunch perform better on average compared to those who eat free/reduced lunch
source.f352101a: there is linear correlation between scores of different subjects
